page.title: 10Employment;Upton Snodsbury.
page.content: The area is sparsely populated, the total inhabitants numbering less than 700, of which 350 are concentrated in Upton Snodsbury. Most of the residents who are in employment work outside the area, commuting to Birmingham, Worcester,Redditch & Pershore. Those working locally are mainly employed in agriculture, but owing to the mechanization of farming methods numbers have fallen dramatically in the last 40 years. One farm which had 20 employees then now has 4. A small number work in the two local garages and the public houses. There are a great many retired persons in the area; some have chosen to come to this lovely area and others have continued to live where they spent their working lives, many in agriculture. Young unmarrieds tend to move away; some return with young families.
